> If its one character on a team, then the advantage is that you can 
invest your money into making him/her better. However, you obviously 
can't use team tactics (ie, a druid stays back and builds a base while 
a thief cloaks and does hit-and-runs on enemy generators).

One character per team.

There's more than just that for disadvantages.  You see, if you have a 
single player team, you have to watch how you spend your money if you 
don't want the character to run too fast or be a sitting duck for 
faeries.
